--- In nbwrpg@y..., robertdahl <rdahl@t...> wrote:
> Firedrill looked up, a serious flicker in his eye. Persecute, was 
not
> one of the words he liked to hear. "I'm with Torca on this one, your
> under our protection now, and nobody has the right to hurt you for a
> design." Firedrill was getting really upset. "I'll see to it." 
> 
> All Beachcomber could do, was looked at him in suprise. He knew
> Firedrill felt strongly about certain things, but he didnt know he 
had
> such a fire for the rights of people. If only Prime could see him, 
it
> was that kind of warrior that kept them fighting, and not doubting 
their
> cause.
> 
> All Cliffjumper could do was shake his head. He didnt like that 
Redhot
> was related to Starscream. That name just burned a hole in his fuel
> pump, but he couldnt hold that against him, no matter how much he 
wanted
> to. "Cool it kid." he said reffering to Firedrill. "Okay guys, we 
need a
> plan. We're all outcasts, of a sort, and right now we are 
vulnerable. We
> need a base of operations, and a place to safely..." he paused, 
looking
> at Redhot, "to repair Redhot."
**************

::REDHOT::

    The red and black seeker was entertained by Firedrill's surge of 
emotion.
    (Downright lusty one) he thought, a sly smile lighting his 
features. (I remember when I used to teach 'cons with his enthusiasm. 
His comrads should be thrilled to have people like him.)
    "Thank you." he said, winking at Firedrill.
    He looked at Cliffjumper when he spoke and utter relief lit his 
eyes when repairs were mentioned.
    "Primus..YES. I need to.. rest. I... barely... have the strength 
to... stand." he said.

Northlight
Domnijoe Productions

****************
